member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBdaImsFileAccess.FrameCycleInfo(Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IIntRange,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFilters,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Get information about which frame participate in each high/low fragmentation frame cycle for all cycles that have a frame within the specified range and which meet the specified filter criteria.
member.param: Null means the entire file
Null means no filtering
The number of frames referenced in the returned list. May be less than 2 times the cycles count, as some cycles may be partial.
member.returns: Null for files without high/low fragmentation data, else a list with one entry for each qualified frame cycle.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBdaImsFileAccess.FrameInfo(Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IDoubleRange,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.AbundanceMeasure,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get frame info applicable to a range of frames combined into a single frame. CAUTION: For combined frames, the Tic and AbundRange values are only estimates unless abundMeasure == Sum.
member.param: The desired range in Minutes, Seconds or FrameNumber
How abundance values are to be combined.
If true and the file has fixed cycle length data, then the frame range is expanded as needed to include all frames in any cycle overlapping the specified acqTimeRange
member.remarks: Does not read the frame spectrum data, only metadata

How abundance values are to be combined
If true and the file has fixed cycle length data, then the frame range is expanded as needed to include all frames in any cycle that holds any of the specified frame numbers
member.remarks: Does not read the frame spectrum data, only metadata

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IIms4DSlice
member.summary: Represents the ion abundance data contained in a single LC-IM-MS data file as a collection of 4-dimensional data points, and allows extraction of various 2D or 3D subssets of that data.

Extract a 3D slice from specified X and Y dimensions of the file in which the reported abundance values at each (x,y) point represent a specified measure of abundance across some portion of the Z dimension at that point. ///
member.param: May be either RT or DT
May be either DT or MZ (but not the same as xDimension)
Null or empty if the entire Z dimension range should be included in the abundance measurement. Else, the range in which a point must fall for its abundance value to be included.
How multiple points within the z range are combined to get the reported abundance for each (x,y) point - one of Sum, Max or Average.

Null implies no filtering - all data in the file (within the specified zRange) is eligible. Else the IExtractDetailsMsSpec.ApplicableFilters property specifies which of the values in the object are to be used as filters and only data acquired with matching attributes (and within the specified zRange) is extracted.
If non-null and with length > 0, returned as the data for a Log(10) abundance histogram of all points in the 3DSlice, scaled 10 points to the decade.
member.returns: The requested 3D slice
member.remarks: The IMS Browser displays a 3D slice as a abundance map with axes matching the X and Y dimensions and color scheme that encodes the abundance at each (x,y) point.

member.summary: Extract a 2D slice from the data file. ///
member.param: Specifies which of the three independent dimensions (RT, DT, MZ) corresponds to the x-axis dimension of the returned 2D object (the y-axis is always abundance). If not empty, specifies the x-limits for the returned object.

A range (in either of the two independent dimensions orthogonal to resultXDimension) into which a point must fall for its abundance value to be included in the result. The units of the range imply which dimension this applies to. Null or empty implies "no limit" in ANY orthogonal dimension

Like orthoRange1, but for the third independent dimension (orthogonal to both resultXDimension and that of orthoRange1).Null or empty implies "no limit" in this third dimension. May only be specified if orthoRange1 is also specified.
If resultXRange is AcqTime, whether an "instrument curve" chromatogram should be extracted and, if so, what data type to use for the Y values.
How multiple points with the same result x-value are combined to get the abundance reported in the result - one of Sum, Max or Average. ///

Null implies no filtering (all data in the file is eligible). Else the IExtractDetailsMsSpec.ApplicableFilters property specifies which of the values in the object are to be used as filters (only data acquired with matching attributes is extracted).
If non-null and with length > 0, returned as the data for a Log(10) abundance histogram of all points in the 3DSlice, scaled 10 points to the decade.
member.returns: The requested 2D slice

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IIms4DSlice.Get2DSlice(Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IDoubleRange,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IGraphics2DRegion[],System.Boolean,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.AbundanceMeasure,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFilters,System.Int32[]@)
member.summary: A more general function to extract a 2D slice from the data file. More complicated to implement and we may not support this.
member.param: Specifies which of the three independent dimensions (RT, DT, MZ) corresponds to the x-axis dimension of the returned 2D object (the y-axis is always abundance). If not empty, specifies the x-limits for the returned object.

A list of regions in the "orthogonal plane" defined by the two independent dimensions orthogonal to resultXDimension. The union of these regions specify locations in that plane into which a data point must fall to be included in the result. Each region may correspond to a 2D rectangle or polygon in the orthogonal plane. Alternatively, each region may correspond to a 1D range or zero-width range (all in one dimension of the orthogonal plane).
If true, only data points falling inside at least one of the specified orthogonal regions are included. If false, only data points outside of all regions are included.
How multiple points with the same result x-value are combined to get the abundance reported in the result - one of Sum, Max or Average. ///

Null implies no filtering (all data in the file is eligible). Else the IExtractDetailsMsSpec.ApplicableFilters property specifies which of the values in the object are to be used as filters (only data acquired with matching attributes is extracted).
If non-null and with length > 0, returned as the data for a Log(10) abundance histogram of all points in the 3DSlice, scaled 10 points to the decade.
member.returns: The requested 2D slice

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.MsDetailAndFilterBase
member.summary: A base class holding data values used in the closely related IMidacMsFilters* and IMidacMsDetails* interfaces. These are properties commonly used to filter MS data for spectrum or chromatogram extraction, and used to describe the actual detailed values found while doing such extractions.

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFilters
member.summary: Provides access to common filter parameters used in extracting mass spectra and MS-based chromatograms. Spectrum and chromatogram extraction each use a subset of the values available via this interface.
member.remarks: IMsFiltersSpec and IMsFiltersChrom define the subsets appropriate for extraction of spectra and chromatograms.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFilters.Clone
member.summary: Make a deep copy of this instance

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFilters.AcqTimeRange
member.summary: For chromatograms. The (single) acquisition time range over which chromatogram data should be extracted, if anything less than the entire file. Null or empty means "entire file".
member.remarks: A null or empty range results in an exception if the corresponding bit is set in ApplicableFilters.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFilters.AcqTimeRanges
member.summary: For spectra. The acquisition time ranges over which spectrum data should be extracted, if anything less than the entire file. Null or empty means "entire file".

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFilters.ApplicableFilters
member.summary: The [Flags] enumeration that specifies which of the other properties in this interface should actually be used to filter data. Any property whose corresponding bit in this enumeration is not set is not used as a filter.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFilters.CompensationFieldRange
member.summary: (FAIMS only) Compensation field value

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFilters.DispersionFieldRange
member.summary: (FAIMS only) Compensation field value

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFilters.DriftTimeRanges
member.summary: The drift time range(s) over which data should be extracted (IMS files only).
member.remarks: A zero-width range implies using the single drift time value closest to the specified range. A null or empty range results in an exception if the corresponding bit is set in ApplicableFilters.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFilters.FragmentationClass
member.summary: The fragmentation class (LowEnergy, HighEnergy or both) to which a spectrum must belong if its FragmentationOpMode includes HiLowFrag

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFilters.FragmentationEnergyRange
member.summary: The range into which a spectrum's fragmentation (collision) energy must fall for it to be included. Ignored for unfragmented spectra (i.e., MS(1) spectra having FragmentationOpMode == None).
member.remarks: A null or empty range results in an exception if the corresponding bit is set in ApplicableFilters.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFilters.FragmentationOpMode
member.summary: A [Flags] enumeration specifying fragmentation mode(s) that make a spectrum eligible for inclusion. (None, NonSelective, Selective, HiLowFrag, ...)

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFilters.FragmentorVoltageRange
member.summary: For mass spectrometers with fragmentor voltages, the range of fragmentor voltages into which a spectrum's value must fall for it to be included.
member.remarks: A null or empty range results in an exception if the corresponding bit is set in ApplicableFilters.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFilters.IonizationMode
member.summary: Type of ionization (ESI, APCI, EI, ...)

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFilters.IonPolarity
member.summary: ** Ion polarities of MS scans to be extracted.
member.remarks: A value of "Mixed" may result in returning two spectra if both MS and MS/MS spectra meet other filter criteria.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFilters.MsLevel
member.summary: ** The MS level(s) of spectra to be extracted.
member.remarks: A value of "Mixed" may result in returning two spectra if both MS and MS/MS spectra meet other filter criteria.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFilters.MsScanType
member.summary: ** The type(s) of MS scans to be extracted.
member.remarks: For [Q]TOF and IM-MS data, only Scan and ProductIonScan make any sense. A value of "All" may result in returning two spectra if both MS and MS/MS spectra meet other filter criteria.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFilters.MsStorageMode
member.summary: Mass spectrum storage mode.
member.remarks: For IM-MS data, this is ignored except Total Frame Spectra, which are the only spectra that can have PeakDetected spectra.
A value of "Mixed" or "Unspecified" results in an exception if the corresponding bit is set in ApplicableFilters

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFilters.MzExclusionRanges
member.summary: For chromatograms. M/z range(s) that should be excluded from the extraction. Currently used only for BPC chromatograms.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFilters.MzInclusionRanges
member.summary: For chromatograms. The m/z range(s) over which data should be extracted for EIC chromatograms.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFilters.MzOfInterestRanges
member.summary: The range into which an MS/MS spectrum's m/z of interest must fall for it to be included. Ignored for MS(1) spectra.
member.remarks: Zero-width ranges require an "exact" match (within a floating point epsilon). At least one range must be specified if the corresponding bit is set in ApplicableFilters. In reported details, this has multiple entries when different isolation was used for different spectra contributing to a summed spectrum. Empty range = no isolation. Min/max range = wideband isolation. Else a center/width range with center as the nominal m/z and the widths (if non zero) representing the full width of the isolation region.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFilters.ScanSegmentRange
member.summary: For chromatograms. Range of scan segment number(s) to include

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetails
member.summary: Provides access to common metadata about extracted mass spectra and MS-based chromatograms. Spectra and chromatograms each use a subset of the values available via this interface.
member.remarks: IMidacMsDetailsSpec and IMidacMsDetailsChrom define the subsets appropriate for spectra and chromatograms.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetails.Clear
member.summary: restore to an as-initialized state

member.summary: Make a deep copy of this object

member.summary: The single acquisition (retention) time range from which a chromatogram was extracted

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetails.AcqTimeRanges
member.summary: The acquisition (retention) time range(s) from which a spectrum was extracted

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetails.CompensationFieldRange
member.summary: (FAIMS only) Compensation field value

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetails.DispersionFieldRange

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetails.DriftTimeRanges

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetails.FragmentationClass
member.summary: The fragmentation class (e.g., LowEnergy, HighEnergy, Mixed) of the data. Unspecified if unknown or no fragmentation was done.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetails.FragmentationEnergyRange
member.summary: The range of fragmentation (collision) energies used. Null if no fragmentation was done.
member.remarks: A range of 10-30 V indicates that at least one contributing spectrum had a CE of 10V, another had 30V, and there may have been others in between.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetails.FragmentationOpMode
member.summary: What fragmentation operation(s) were used to collect the data in this object

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetails.FragmentorVoltageRange
member.summary: If acquired on an instrument with a fragmentor voltage parameter, the range of that voltage used in producing this data.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetails.IonizationMode
member.summary: The ionization mode being used when these data were acquired.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetails.IonPolarity
member.summary: The ion polarity of this data

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetails.MsLevel
member.summary: The MS level (MS or MS/MS) of the spectra extracted for this object

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetails.MsScanType
member.summary: The MS scan type(s) contributing to this data

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetails.MsStorageMode
member.summary: Whether this data is based on profile or peak-detected representation of spectra

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetails.MzExclusionRanges
member.summary: M/z range(s) that was excluded from the extraction. Currently used only for BPC chromatograms.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetails.MzInclusionRanges
member.summary: The m/z range(s) over which data was extracted for EIC chromatograms.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetails.MzOfInterestRanges
member.summary: For MS/MS data the m/z(s) used as the precursor ion, product ion, or neutral gain or loss. A single range unless this is the combination of multiple spectra with different m/z of interest values; then one range for each unique value.
member.remarks: Quadrupole selection is represented as a CenterWidth range with the isolation m/z as the center. If the actual limits of the (possibly asymmetric) isolation window are known, they are used for the range; otherwise, the range has zero width.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetails.ScanSegmentRange
member.summary: Range of scan segment number(s)

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IExtractDetailsMsChrom
member.summary: Extends the IMidacExtractDetailsMsChrom interface with properties that are not exposed via MIDAC or that use Archer-internal types for some enumerations.

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetailsChrom
member.summary: A subset of IMidacMsDetails applicable to mass spectra

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetailsChrom.Clone
member.summary: Make a deep copy of this object

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetailsChrom.AcqTimeRange
member.summary: The acquisition (retention) time range from which this chromatogram was extracted if the RT range was less than the whole file

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetailsChrom.CompensationFieldRange
member.summary: For FAIMS instruments, the range of compensation field values spanned by the spectra contributing to this chromatogram. Null for non-FAIMS instruments

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetailsChrom.DispersionFieldRange
member.summary: For FAIMS instruments, the range of dispersion field values spanned by the spectra contributing to this chromatogram. Null for non-FAIMS instruments

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetailsChrom.DriftTimeRanges
member.summary: For IM-MS instruments, the range(s) of ion drift times spanned by the spectra contributing to this chromatogram. Null for other instruments or for IM-MS instruments operating in Q-TOF (non-mobility) mode.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetailsChrom.FragmentationClass
member.summary: For High/Low fragmentation experiments, which class this spectrum belongs. Unspecified for other experiment types.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetailsChrom.FragmentationEnergyRange
member.summary: If fragmentation was done, the range of fragmentation (collision) energies applied to the spectra contributing to this chromatogram. Null or empty if no fragmentation was done. IsZeroWidth == true if all contributing spectra had the same value.
member.remarks: Note that zero is a legitimate fragmentation energy. Fragmentor voltage is a separate property

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetailsChrom.FragmentationOpMode
member.summary: A [Flags] enumeration that specifies whether (intentional) fragmentation was done while measuring the data included in this chromatogram. If so, specifies whether that fragmentation was selective (using quadrupole m/z isolation) or not, and whether the chromatogram data were acquired as a part of a hi/low fragmentation experiment.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetailsChrom.FragmentorVoltageRange
member.summary: For instruments with a pre-Quadrupole Fragmentor Voltage setting, the range of fragmentor voltages of all spectra contributing to the chromatogram. Empty if there is no fragmentor. IsZeroWidth == true if all contributing spectra had the same value.
member.remarks: Note that zero is a legitimate (if unlikely) fragmentor voltage.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetailsChrom.IonizationMode
member.summary: Get the ionization technique that was used.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetailsChrom.IonPolarity
member.summary: Get the polarity of the ions on which the chromatogram is based.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetailsChrom.MsLevel
member.summary: MS if single-stage spectra (including nonselective All-Ions spectra) were used to create the chromatogram. MSMS for two-stage spectra (including SWATH type spectra).

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetailsChrom.MsScanType
member.summary: Get the MS scan type of spectra on which this chromatogram is based.
member.remarks: "All-Ions" spectra (non-selective fragmentation) are regarded as MS^^1 spectra of type Scan. SWATH-type experiments would be recorded as MS/MS ProductIon spectra with a non-zero-width m/z of interest range.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetailsChrom.MsStorageMode
member.summary: Whether the data in this chromatogram is based on profile spectra or peak-detected (centroided) spectra.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetailsChrom.MzExclusionRanges
member.summary: If there were m/z ranges excluded from the chromatogram (most common for BPC chromatograms), the ranges that were excluded. Null or empty if no exclusions were used.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetailsChrom.MzInclusionRanges
member.summary: The m/z range(s) of ions contributing to the chromatogram. Not applicable for TIC or BPC chromatograms.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetailsChrom.MzOfInterestRanges
member.summary: For MS/MS chromatograms, the set of unique "m/z of interest" values for the individual spectra contributing to this chromatogram. Null for MS^^1 spectra. For an IDoubleCwRange, the Center corresponds to the designated m/z (e.g., 235.0) while the range Min/Max correspond to the span of the quadrupole isolation window (e.g., 235.0 -0.3 amu + 1.7 amu). May also be a Min/Max range (zero width to report just a single value)
member.remarks: The interpretation of the m/z of interest varies depending on the MsScanType (precursor m/z for product ion scan or MRM transision, neutral loss for neutral loss scan, product m/z for precursor ion scan, etc.)

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetailsChrom.ScanSegmentRange
member.summary: Range of scan segment number(s) included

member.summary: An implementation of IExtractFiltersMsChrom

member.summary: Like the (MIDAC) IMidacChromFiltersMs, but with Archer types for some enumerations

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersChrom
member.summary: Provides a subset of IMidacMsFilters appropriate for extracting MS-based chromatograms

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersChrom.Clone
member.summary: Make a deep copy of this object

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersChrom.ApplicableFilters
member.summary: The [Flags] enumeration that specifies which of the other properties in this interface should actually be used to filter data. Any property whose corresponding bit in this enumeration is not set is not used as a filter.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersChrom.AcqTimeRange
member.summary: The acquisition time range over which data should be extracted, if anything less than the entire file. Null or empty means "entire file".
member.remarks: A null or empty range results in an exception if the corresponding bit is set in ApplicableFilters.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersChrom.CompensationFieldRange
member.summary: (FAIMS only) Compensation field value

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersChrom.DispersionFieldRange
member.summary: (FAIMS only) Compensation field value

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersChrom.DriftTimeRanges
member.summary: The drift time range(s) over which data should be extracted (IMS files only).
member.remarks: A zero-width range implies using the single drift time value closest to the specified range. A null or empty range results in an exception if the corresponding bit is set in ApplicableFilters.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersChrom.FragmentationClass
member.summary: The fragmentation class (LowEnergy, HighEnergy or both) to which a spectrum must belong if its FragmentationOpMode includes HiLowFrag

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersChrom.FragmentationEnergyRange
member.summary: The range into which a spectrum's fragmentation (collision) energy must fall for it to be included. Ignored for unfragmented spectra (i.e., MS(1) spectra having FragmentationOpMode == None).
member.remarks: A null or empty range results in an exception if the corresponding bit is set in ApplicableFilters.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersChrom.FragmentationOpMode
member.summary: A [Flags] enumeration specifying fragmentation mode(s) that make a spectrum eligible for inclusion. (None, NonSelective, Selective, HiLowFrag, ...)

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersChrom.FragmentorVoltageRange
member.summary: For mass spectrometers with fragmentor voltages, the range of fragmentor voltages into which a spectrum's value must fall for it to be included.
member.remarks: A null or empty range results in an exception if the corresponding bit is set in ApplicableFilters.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersChrom.IonizationMode
member.summary: Type of ionization (ESI, APCI, EI, ...)

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersChrom.IonPolarity
member.summary: ** Ion polarities of MS scans to be extracted.
member.remarks: A value of "Mixed" may result in returning two spectra if both MS and MS/MS spectra meet other filter criteria.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersChrom.MsLevel
member.summary: ** The MS level(s) of spectra to be extracted.
member.remarks: A value of "Mixed" may result in returning two spectra if both MS and MS/MS spectra meet other filter criteria.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersChrom.MsScanType
member.summary: ** The type(s) of MS scans to be extracted.
member.remarks: For [Q]TOF and IM-MS data, only Scan and ProductIonScan make any sense. A value of "All" may result in returning two spectra if both MS and MS/MS spectra meet other filter criteria.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersChrom.MsStorageMode
member.summary: Mass spectrum storage mode.
member.remarks: For IM-MS data, this is ignored except Total Frame Spectra, which are the only spectra that can have PeakDetected spectra.
A value of "Mixed" or "Unspecified" results in an exception if the corresponding bit is set in ApplicableFilters

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersChrom.MzOfInterestRanges
member.summary: The range into which an MS/MS spectrum's m/z of interest must fall for it to be included. Ignored for MS(1) spectra.
member.remarks: Zero-width ranges require an "exact" match (within a floating point epsilon). At least one range must be specified if the corresponding bit is set in ApplicableFilters

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersChrom.MzExclusionRanges
member.summary: M/z range(s) that should be excluded from the extraction. Currently used only for BPC chromatograms.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersChrom.MzInclusionRanges
member.summary: The m/z range(s) over which data should be extracted for EIC chromatograms.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersChrom.ScanSegmentRange
member.summary: Range of scan segment number(s) to include

member.remarks: A null or empty range results in an exception if the corresponding bit is set in ApplicableFilters.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersSpec.FragmentationOpMode
member.summary: A [Flags] enumeration specifying fragmentation mode(s) that make a spectrum eligible for inclusion. (None, NonSelective, Selective, HiLowFrag, ...)

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersSpec.FragmentorVoltageRange
member.summary: For mass spectrometers with fragmentor voltages, the range of fragmentor voltages into which a spectrum's value must fall for it to be included.
member.remarks: A null or empty range results in an exception if the corresponding bit is set in ApplicableFilters.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersSpec.IonizationMode
member.summary: Type of ionization (ESI, APCI, EI, ...)

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersSpec.IonPolarity
member.summary: ** Ion polarities of MS scans to be extracted.
member.remarks: A value of "Mixed" may result in returning two spectra if both MS and MS/MS spectra meet other filter criteria.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersSpec.MsLevel
member.summary: ** The MS level(s) of spectra to be extracted.
member.remarks: A value of "Mixed" may result in returning two spectra if both MS and MS/MS spectra meet other filter criteria.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersSpec.MsScanType
member.summary: ** The type(s) of MS scans to be extracted.
member.remarks: For [Q]TOF and IM-MS data, only Scan and ProductIonScan make any sense. A value of "All" may result in returning two spectra if both MS and MS/MS spectra meet other filter criteria.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersSpec.MsStorageMode
member.summary: Mass spectrum storage mode.
member.remarks: For IM-MS data, this is ignored except Total Frame Spectra, which are the only spectra that can have PeakDetected spectra.
A value of "Mixed" or "Unspecified" results in an exception if the corresponding bit is set in ApplicableFilters

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersSpec.MzOfInterestRanges
member.summary: The range into which an MS/MS spectrum's m/z of interest must fall for it to be included. Ignored for MS(1) spectra.
member.remarks: Zero-width ranges require an "exact" match (within a floating point epsilon). At least one range must be specified if the corresponding bit is set in ApplicableFilters

member.summary: The fragmentation class (e.g., LowEnergy, HighEnergy, Mixed) of the spectrum. Unspecified if unknown or no fragmentation was done.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetailsSpec.FragmentationEnergyRange
member.summary: The range of fragmentation (collision) energies used. Null if no fragmentation was done.
member.remarks: A range of 10-30 V indicates that at least one contributing spectrum had a CE of 10V, another had 30V, and there may have been others in between.

member.summary: What fragmentation operation(s) were used to collect the data in this spectrum

member.summary: If acquired on an instrument with a fragmentor voltage parameter, the range of that voltage used in producing this spectrum.

member.summary: The ionization mode being used when these data were acquired.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetailsSpec.IonPolarity
member.summary: The ion polarity of this spectrum

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetailsSpec.MsLevel
member.summary: The MS level (MS or MS/MS) of this spectrum

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetailsSpec.MsScanType
member.summary: The MS scan type(s) contributing to this spectrum

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetailsSpec.MsStorageMode
member.summary: Whether this data is a profile or peak-detected representation of the spectrum

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsDetailsSpec.MzOfInterestRanges
member.summary: For MS/MS spectra the m/z(s) used as the precursor ion, product ion, or neutral gain or loss. A single range unless this is the combination of multiple spectra with different m/z of interest values; then one range for each unique value.
member.remarks: Quadrupole selection is represented as a CenterWidth range with the isolation m/z as the center. If the actual limits of the (possibly asymmetric) isolation window are known, they are used for the range; otherwise, the range has zero width.

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.RlzAccumulator
member.summary: An RLZ-encoded array combiner that supports accumulating abundance values by taking their maximum, sum, or average. Supports adding of those arrays without the need to decode them, and reports the result as an RLZ-encoded (integer) array.
member.remarks: The result may use a different (simpler) subtype of RLZ encoding than the added arrays.

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IIms3DSlice
member.summary: Represents a 3D slice of data from an LC-IM-MS data file.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IIms3DSlice.Get2DSlice(Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.ImsDimension,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IGraphics2DRegion[],System.Boolean,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.AbundanceMeasure,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFilters)
member.summary: Extract a 2D subset from the data in this 3D slice using the most general specification of the extraction region(s). ///
member.param: The x-axis dimension of the returned 2D object, which must be one of the two independent dimensions of this 3DSlice. The y-axis dimension is always abundance.

A list of regions in the plane defined by the two independent dimensions of the 3DSlice. The union of these regions specify locations in that plane into which a data point must fall to be included in the result. Each region may correspond to a 2D rectangle or polygon in the plane. Alternatively, each region may correspond to a 1D range or zero-width range (all in one dimension of the plane).
If true, only data points falling inside at least one of the selection region(s) are included. If false, only data points outside of all regions are included.
How multiple points with the same result x-value are combined to get the abundance reported in the result - one of Sum, Max or Average. ///

Null implies no filtering (all data in the file is eligible). Else the IExtractDetailsMsSpec.ApplicableFilters property specifies which of the values in the object are to be used as filters (only data acquired with matching attributes is extracted).
member.returns: The requested 2D slice

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IIms3DSlice.Get2DSlice(Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.ImsDimension,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IDoubleRange[],System.Boolean,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.AbundanceMeasure,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFilters)
member.summary: Extract a 2D subset from the data in this 3D slice.
member.param: The x-axis dimension of the returned 2D object, which must be one of the two independent dimensions of this 3DSlice. The y-axis dimension is always abundance.
Specifies the range(s) into which data must fall to be included in the result. The dimension of this range must be the independent dimension of the 3DSlice that is orthogonal to the resultXDimension.
If true, only data points falling inside at least one of the specified ranges are included. If false, only data points outside of all ranges are included.
How multiple points with the same result x-value are combined to get the abundance reported in the result - one of Sum, Max or Average. ///

Null implies no filtering (all data in the file is eligible). Else the IExtractDetailsMsSpec.ApplicableFilters property specifies which of the values in the object are to be used as filters (only data acquired with matching attributes is extracted).
member.returns: The requested 2D slice

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IAbundMapRegionSelection
member.summary: A collection of values representing a region (in any units) selected within an IM-MS abundance map (FrameView or FileOverview). Intended to serve ranges for various filtering operations; those ranges are always in units of FrameNumber, DriftBin and FlightTimeBin. The X and Y values may be X Y DT MZ FrameView abundance map RT DT File Overview DT vs RT abundance map RT MZ File Overview m/z vs RT abundance map The selection may represent any of the following: (a) a mass/drift time/retention time point (zero-width range with mass, drift or frame units) (b) a 1-dimensional drift time range (c) a 1-dimensional mass range (d) a 1-dimensional frame range (e) a 2-dimensional rectangle (in any supported X,Y combination) (f) a 2-dimensional polygon (n any supported X,Y combination)

member.summary: For Rectangle or Polygon, get the collection of Y ranges (in bin units) that fall within the selection at different X bins. The Dictionary is keyed by X, each entry is a list of Y ranges whose points fall within the region.

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.Range`1
member.summary: A generic, light-weight, min/max range class for value types
member.remarks: Using a type that cannot be converted to a double will cause exceptions in calls to get_Center and ToString()

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IRange`1
member.summary: Interface for a simple range with values of a specified type.
member.remarks: Functions to set the values of the range are in derived interfaces.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IRange`1.SetMinMax(`0,`0)
member.summary: Set the lower and upper value of the range. These are automatically reordered if necessary to ensure that Min is less than or equal to Max
member.remarks: Derived ICenterRange sets the center to the mean of min, max

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IRange`1.Clear
member.summary: Make the range empty (without affecting its units, if any)

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IRange`1.Equals(Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IRange{`0})
member.summary: Does this range equal some other, specified, range?
member.remarks: Comparison for floating point types is to within 2 Epsilon. Comparison for all other types is for exact match.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IRange`1.Contains(`0)
member.summary: Does a specified value fall within the limits of the range?

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IRange`1.Contains(Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IRange{`0})
member.summary: Does a specified other range fall entirely within the limits of this range?

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IRange`1.ConstrainTo(Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IRange{`0})
member.summary: Clip the values in this range if necessary to ensure that they do not exceed the specified range. If the current values fall within the specified range, no change is made.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IRange`1.Clone
member.summary: Override Object.Clone to make a deep copy of this range

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IRange`1.ToString
member.summary: Override Object.ToString to return formated string of this range. A single number is returned when min equals max, otherwise the two range numbers are returned separated by a dash. An empty string is returned if the range is empty.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IRange`1.Center
member.summary: Returns the center of the range. This will be the same as (Min + Max) / 2 except for ranges that also support ICenterRange
member.remarks: Return type is double rather than T so that accurate Center values can be returned for integer types.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IRange`1.Min
member.summary: Get the lower value of the range

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IRange`1.Max
member.summary: Get the upper value of the range

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IRange`1.Units
member.summary: Set or get the units of the range's values.
member.remarks: Changing the units does NOT change the values, only records the units that the current values are supposed to be in. The caller is responsible for making both changes.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IRange`1.IsEmpty
member.summary: Get a flag that indicates whether the range is empty. An empty range is one that has not had both a min and max value set.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IRange`1.IsSymmetric
member.summary: Returns true if the range's Center is halfway between its Min and Max values. Always true except for ranges that also support ICenterRange.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IRange`1.IsZeroWidth
member.summary: Get a flag that indicates whether the min and max values of the range are equal (it is a zero-width range). Will return false if the range is empty.

member.summary: An implementation for IMidacChromDataMs

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacChromDataMs
member.summary: Provides access to a spectrum extracted from an Agilent MS or IM-MS data file.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacChromDataMs.ChromatogramType
member.summary: The kind of chromatogram represented by this instance

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacChromDataMs.CompensationFieldRange
member.summary: For FAIMS instruments, the range of compensation field values spanned by the spectra contributing to this chromatogram. Null for non-FAIMS instruments

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacChromDataMs.DispersionFieldRange
member.summary: For FAIMS instruments, the range of dispersion field values spanned by the spectra contributing to this chromatogram. Null for non-FAIMS instruments

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacChromDataMs.DriftTimeRanges
member.summary: For IM-MS instruments, the range(s) of ion drift times spanned by the spectra contributing to this chromatogram. Null for other instruments or for IM-MS instruments operating in Q-TOF (non-mobility) mode.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacChromDataMs.FragmentationClass
member.summary: For High/Low fragmentation experiments, which class this spectrum belongs. Unspecified for other experiment types.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacChromDataMs.FragmentationEnergyRange
member.summary: If fragmentation was done, the range of fragmentation (collision) energies applied to the spectra contributing to this chromatogram. Null or empty == no fragmentation was done. Zero Width if all contributing spectra had the same value.
member.remarks: Note that zero is a legitimate fragmentation energy. Fragmentor voltage is a separate property

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacChromDataMs.FragmentationOpMode
member.summary: A [Flags] enumeration that specifies whether (intentional) fragmentation was done while measuring the data included in this spectrum. If so, specifies whether that fragmentation was selective (using quadrupole m/z isolation) or not, and whether the spectrum was acquired as a part of a hi/low fragmentation experiment.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacChromDataMs.FragmentorVoltageRange
member.summary: For instruments with a pre-Quadrupole Fragmentor Voltage setting, the range of fragmentor voltages of all spectra contributing to the chromatogram. IsEmpty == true if there is no fragmentor. IsZeroWidth == true if all contributing spectra had the same value.
member.remarks: Note that zero is a legitimate (if unlikely) fragmentor voltage.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacChromDataMs.IonizationMode
member.summary: Get the ionization technique that was used

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacChromDataMs.IonPolarity
member.summary: Get the polarity of the ions in the chromatogram

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacChromDataMs.IsCycleSummed
member.summary: True if each point in this chromatogram is the sum of values from all spectra in a cycle

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacChromDataMs.MsLevel
member.summary: MS for chromatograms based on single-stage spectra (including nonselective All-Ions spectra), MSMS for those based on two-stage spectra (including SWATH type spectra).

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacChromDataMs.MzExclusionRanges
member.summary: The m/z ranges (if any) excluded during extraction (e.g., for selective BPC)

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacChromDataMs.MzInclusionRanges
member.summary: Specific m/z ranges included during extraction (e.g., for EIC)

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacChromDataMs.MzOfInterestRanges
member.summary: For chromatograms based on MS/MS spectra, the set of unique "m/z of interest" values for the individual spectra contributing to this chromatogram. Null for MS^^1 spectra. For an IDoubleCwRange, the Center corresponds to the designated m/z (e.g., 235.0) while the range Min/Max correspond to the span of the quadrupole isolation window (e.g., 235.0 -0.3 amu + 1.7 amu). May also be a Min/Max range (zero width to report just a single value)
member.remarks: The interpretation of the m/z of interest varies depending on the MsScanType (precursor m/z for product ion scan or MRM transision, neutral loss for neutral loss scan, product m/z for precursor ion scan, etc.)

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacChromDataMs.ScanSegmentRange
member.summary: For chromatograms including data from selected scan segments, the scan segments from which the data were extracted.

member.summary: The X (retention time) values of the chromatogram points

member.summary: The units of the X values

member.summary: The Y values of the chromatogram points

member.summary: Provides access to a spectrum extracted from an Agilent MS or IM-MS data file.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacSpecData.AcquiredTimeRanges
member.summary: Get the collection of time ranges over which spectra were summed or averaged to create this object.
member.remarks: If SpectrumCount == 1, this will be a single, zero-width range.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacSpecData.IsAverage
member.summary: True if this spectrum is the average of two or more individual spectra. If false but SpectrumCount > 1, then this is the sum of individual spectra rather than an average.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacSpecData.MaxProfilePoints
member.summary: For profile spectra, the number of points the spectrum would have if all zero-abundance points were included. Zero for centroided (peak) spectra.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacSpecData.NonZeroPoints
member.summary: The number of points with non-zero abundance in this spectrum. (Applies to both profile and peak spectra).

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacSpecData.SpectrumCount
member.summary: The number of individual measured spectra that are included in this one (if an average or sum).
member.remarks: IBDASpecData.TotalScanCount

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacSpecData.SpectrumType
member.summary: What kind of spectrum does this data represent?

member.summary: In what format are the (x,y) data stored?

member.summary: Get the array of x values

member.summary: If the spectrum has (or is derived from) equally-spaced data points, the spacing of points.
member.remarks: Nanometers for UvVisSpectra; m/z for Q or QQQ MzSpectra, Nanoseconds for [Q]TOF MzSpectra, milliseconds for DriftSpectra

member.summary: Get the array of y values

member.summary: Get information about the device that produced the data in this object

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacSpecDataMs.AbundanceLimit
member.summary: For [Q]TOF spectra, the abundance value that is the largest value that could be seen in this spectrum (the "fully saturated" value).

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacSpecDataMs.CompensationFieldRange
member.summary: For FAIMS instruments, the range of compensation field values spanned by the spectra contributing to this average or sumed spectrum. Null for non-FAIMS instruments

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacSpecDataMs.DispersionFieldRange
member.summary: For FAIMS instruments, the range of dispersion field values spanned by the spectra contributing to this average or sumed spectrum. Null for non-FAIMS instruments

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacSpecDataMs.DriftTimeRanges
member.summary: For IM-MS instruments, the range(s) of ion drift times spanned by the spectra contributing to this average or summed spectrum. Null for other instruments or for IM-MS instruments operating in Q-TOF (non-mobility) mode.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacSpecDataMs.FragmentationClass
member.summary: For High/Low fragmentation experiments, which class this spectrum belongs. Unspecified for other experiment types.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacSpecDataMs.FragmentationEnergyRange
member.summary: If fragmentation was done, the range of fragmentation (collision) energies applied to the spectra contributing to this average or summed spectrum. Null if no fragmentation was done. IsEmpty == true if no fragmentation was done. IsZeroWidth == true if all contributing spectra had the same value.
member.remarks: Note that zero is a legitimate fragmentation energy. Fragmentor voltage is a separate property

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacSpecDataMs.FragmentationOpMode
member.summary: A [Flags] enumeration that specifies whether (intentional) fragmentation was done while measuring the data included in this spectrum. If so, specifies whether that fragmentation was selective (using quadrupole m/z isolation) or not, and whether the spectrum was acquired as a part of a hi/low fragmentation experiment.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacSpecDataMs.FragmentorVoltageRange
member.summary: For instruments with a pre-Quadrupole Fragmentor Voltage setting, the range of fragmentor voltages of all spectra contributing to the sum (or average). IsEmpty == true if there is no fragmentor. IsZeroWidth == true if all contributing spectra had the same value.
member.remarks: Note that zero is a legitimate (if unlikely) fragmentor voltage.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacSpecDataMs.IonizationMode
member.summary: Get the ionization technique that was used

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacSpecDataMs.IonPolarity
member.summary: Get the polarity of the ions in the spectrum

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacSpecDataMs.MsLevel
member.summary: MS for single-stage spectra (including nonselective All-Ions spectra), MSMS for two-stage spectra (including SWATH type spectra).

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacSpecDataMs.MsScanType
member.summary: Get the MS scan type.
member.remarks: "All-Ions" spectra (non-selective fragmentation) are regarded as MS^^1 spectra of type Scan. SWATH-type experiments would be recorded as MS/MS ProductIon spectra with a non-zero-width m/z of interest range.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacSpecDataMs.MsStorageMode
member.summary: Whether the data in this object represents a profile spectrum or a peak-detected (centroided) spectrum.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacSpecDataMs.MzOfInterestRanges
member.summary: For MS/MS spectra, the set of unique "m/z of interest" values for the individual spectra contributing to this average or summed spectrum. Null for MS^^1 spectra. For an IDoubleCwRange, the Center corresponds to the designated m/z (e.g., 235.0) while the range Min/Max correspond to the span of the quadrupole isolation window (e.g., 235.0 -0.3 amu + 1.7 amu). May also be a Min/Max range (zero width to report just a single value)
member.remarks: The interpretation of the m/z of interest varies depending on the MsScanType (precursor m/z for product ion scan or MRM transision, neutral loss for neutral loss scan, product m/z for precursor ion scan, etc.)

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacSpecDataMs.ParentScanIdArray
member.summary: For Auto-MS/MS or Triggered MRM spectra, the ScanId(s) of the spectra that triggered the acquisition of this spectrum. Null in other cases.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacSpecDataMs.ScanId
member.summary: For single (non-summed and non-averaged) spectra, an integer identifier for the spectrum that is unique withing the data file. Zero for any "combined" spectrum.

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IImsConvertibleUnitContainer
member.summary: An interface implemented by any object that holds data values that can and ought to be changed when units are changed. The object need not hold information about how to do the conversion, but it does need to know which of its values need to be converted and what their current units are.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IImsConvertibleUnitContainer.ChangeUnits(Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IImsUnits,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IImsUnitConverter)
member.summary: Change all convertible values within the object to match the desired units.
member.param: The desired units
A converter that can be used to do the actual value conversions
member.returns: true if any changes were made; false if all values were already in the desired units.

member.summary: File-level metadata for a MassHunter IM-MS data file

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacFileInfo.Clone
member.summary: Make a deep copy of this object

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacFileInfo.AcquisitionDate
member.summary: The date/time that the file was acquired

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacFileInfo.AcquisitionIsComplete
member.summary: Flag that indicates whether acquisition of the data is complete. If not, data acquisition may yet write more data into it.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacFileInfo.AcquisitionSofwareVersion
member.summary: Version information about the software used to aquire the data file

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacFileInfo.DriftGas
member.summary: Get the forumula of the drift gas used during this run.
member.remarks: Could be "Nitrogen" instead of "N2" for older data files.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacFileInfo.FilePath
member.summary: The file path up to and including the x.d folder

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacFileInfo.FileUnitConverter
member.summary: Get a unit converter. This can accurately convert chromatographic units, and can convert mass- and drift-spectrum units using file average values.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacFileInfo.HasHiLoFragData
member.summary: True if the data file has alternating high and low fragmentation frames (e.g., AllIons data)

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacFileInfo.HasTgtMsMsData
member.summary: True if the file contains Targeted MS/MS data (in which the quadrupole is used to select the m/z of ions to be fragmented after the drift region)

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacFileInfo.FileHasTrapPressure
member.summary: Does the file have the trap pressure recorded?

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacFileInfo.InstrumentName
member.summary: The name of the instrument on which the data were acquired.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacFileInfo.MaxAcqTime
member.summary: The acquisition (retention) time of the last frame in the data file, in minutes.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacFileInfo.MaxFlightTimeBin
member.summary: The bin number (0-based) of the longest flight time possible for any mass spectrum in this file.
member.remarks: MaxFlightTime (ns) = MaxFlightTimeBin * TofBinWidth

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacFileInfo.MaxNonTfsMsPerFrame
member.summary: The largest number of mass spectra (each corresponding to one "drift bin") in any frame in the file. Does not count the TFS present in each frame.
member.remarks: A drift bin with an empty (all-zero) mass spectrum counts towards this value. It does not count the Total Frame Spectrum that may also be stored with each frame.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacFileInfo.NumFrames
member.summary: The number of frames in the file

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacFileInfo.Polarity
member.summary: Get the ion polarity (or polarities) of data in the file.
member.remarks: This ccould someday be Mixed, but only single-polarity IMS files are currently supported.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacFileInfo.TfsMsDetails
member.summary: A mass spectrum metadata summary for the entire file.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IImsFileInfo.Clone
member.summary: Make a deep copy of this object (except for the unit converter, which is only a reference copy)
member.remarks: overrides MIDAC type

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IImsFileInfo.DefaultTofCalibration(Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IonPolarity)
member.summary: Get the default TOF mass calibration for data of a specified ion polarity
member.returns: null if there are no data of the specified polarity

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IImsFileInfo.MaxMassBin

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IImsFileInfo.MeasurementType

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IImsFileInfo.MinMassBin

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacFrameInfo
member.summary: Frame-specific metadata applicable to an extracted frame (or sum of frames)

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacFrameInfo.Clone
member.summary: Get a (SHALLOW) copy of this object. Doubles and ranges are cloned, references to larger objects are not.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacFrameInfo.AbundRange
member.summary: Get the range of abundance values in the frame.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacFrameInfo.AcqTimeRange
member.summary: Get the range of acquisition times (e.g., retention times) represented by the frames that were combined to create the frame. In minutes.

member.summary: Get the range of drift bins in the frame.
member.remarks: Same as DriftTimeRange except for units. Spans all acquired data, including bins with all-zero abundance points

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacFrameInfo.DriftField
member.summary: Get the strength of the drift field during this frame (V/cm).

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacFrameInfo.DriftPressure
member.summary: Get the drift region pressure measured when this frame was acquired.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacFrameInfo.TrapPressure
member.summary: Get the pressure in the trap preceding the drift region

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacFrameInfo.DriftTemperature
member.summary: Get the drift region temperature measured when this frame was acquired.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacFrameInfo.DriftTimeRange
member.summary: Get the range of drift times in the frame. In milliseconds.
member.remarks: Spans all acquired data, including bins with all-zero abundance points

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacFrameInfo.FileInfo
member.summary: A reference to overall information about the file from which this frame was extracted.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacFrameInfo.FragmentationEnergyRange
member.summary: The range of fragmentation energies used in this frame. Null if this FrameInfo represents an entire run rather than a specific [averaged] frame. Empty or 0:0 if no fragmentation is done.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacFrameInfo.FragmentationOpMode
member.summary: The fragmentation operation mode used to acquire the frame (or the modes, plural, if a summed frame using different modes)

The implication is that if there are two exact same transition A->B set up for different time segment or different method #, they will only appear once in this list.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDASpecData.DispersionField
member.summary: Get the FAIMS dispersion field value in effect when this spectrum was acquired. This will be NaN if there is no FAIMS data, or if this is the average of spectra acquired with different DF values.

member.summary:
Return a list of RangeTranslators. If m_bMultipleChroms==true, each range translator represents an include mass range in the chrom filter, plus it would have subtracted out the exclude mass range.
If m_bMultipleChroms==false, there will only be one RangeTranslator in the list, and this RangeTranslator would have merged the include mass ranges and getting rid of excluded masses.
Basically, a chromatogram is generated for each RangeFilter in the list.
member.param: Initiall empty, filled in by this method with valid mass ranges. Will be populated regardless of what type of data including ICPMS.

member.summary: Finds the closest scan numbers for the retention times (In array conversion) Handles a single as well as multiple points. Takes care of 1. Rounding of values 2. Clipping the values to the rang DOES NOT ASSUME Monotonically increasing order!, however that case will never come
member.param: array of values, expected as scan numbers as input Returned back as retention times, specified by dataUnit
specifies the dataUnit of output array. The method does gives back values in expected dataUnit, i.e. second or minute. If second unit, does conversion on the fly from default minutes values

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.MSScanInfoMgr_Common.GetClosestScanNumbers(System.Double[],Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.DataUnit)
member.summary: Finds the closest scan numbers for the given retention times. (in array conversion) Handles a single as well as multiple points. 1. If the retention time is within the range, finds the CLOSEST retention time and for that, the corresponding scan number 2. If the retention time is out of range, it will clip to to start or end retention time and get the corresponding scan number ASSUMES:: Retention times are monotonically increasing Handles retention times, having duplicates as well as where 4, 4.1, 4.2 scan all should map to say 115 scanID
member.param: array of values, expected as minutes or seconds specified by dataUnit. returned back as scannumbers
dataUnit of the current array. If current dataunit is seconds, it converts to default minutes and uses it

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.ChromatogramType
member.summary: Types of chromatograms

member.name: F:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.ChromatogramType.Unspecified
member.summary: Chromatogram type is unknown or not specified

member.name: F:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.ChromatogramType.Signal
member.summary: A chromatogram produced directly by some detector, for instance a signal from one channel of a multi-wavelength detector. Explicitly not extracted from spectral data.

member.name: F:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.ChromatogramType.InstrumentParameter
member.summary: A "chromatogram" that represents how some instrument parameter or setting changed over time during a run.

member.name: F:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.ChromatogramType.TotalWavelength
member.summary: A chromatogram representing the summed response at all wavelengths from an optical spectrometry detector.

member.name: F:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.ChromatogramType.ExtractedWavelength
member.summary: A chromatogram representing the summed response over selected wavelength range(s) from an optical spectrometry detector

member.name: F:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.ChromatogramType.TotalIon
member.summary: A chromatogram representing the summed ion abundance at all m/z values for a mass spectral detector.

member.name: F:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.ChromatogramType.BasePeak
member.summary: A chromatogram representing the intensity of the most abundant ion over specified m/z range(s) for a mass spectral detector.

member.name: F:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.ChromatogramType.ExtractedIon
member.summary: A chromatogram representing the sum of ion abundances over specified m/z range(s) for a mass spectral detector.

member.name: F:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.ChromatogramType.ExtractedCompound
member.summary: A chromatogram produced by a data mining algorithm (e.g., MFE) based on the data identified as belonging to a single compound

member.name: F:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.ChromatogramType.NeutralLoss
member.summary: A chromatogram representing the intensity in a neutral loss transition where any precursor ion that loses a designated neutral mass to become the corresponding product ion.

member.name: F:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.ChromatogramType.MultipleReactionMode
member.summary: A chromtogram produced from QQQ multiple reaction mode data

member.name: F:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.ChromatogramType.SelectedIonMonitoring
member.summary: A chromatogram produced from single ion monitoring data

member.name: F:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.ChromatogramType.TotalCompound
member.summary: A chromatogram representing the sum of the ExtractedCompound chromatograms from a data mining algorithm

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.Ionization
member.summary: The technique(s) used to produce ions for mass spectral analysis
member.remarks: Use as [Flags] (with multiple values) only when multiple modes are used at the same time (e.g., ESI + APCI for the dual-mode ion source). Otherwise, use a single value or "Mixed" to indicate that data acquired with several different ionization modes has been merged together.

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.MsStorageMode
member.summary: Whether a mass spectrum is peak-detected prior to storage in the data file or in a memory-resident object. If not, it is Profile. If applied to a collection of multiple spectra, it may be Mixed.

member.name: F:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.MsStorageMode.Unspecified
member.summary: Storage mode is unknown (for results) or is unspecified (for data access requests)

member.name: F:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.MsStorageMode.Mixed
member.summary: A collection of spectra is a combination; some are peak detected while others are profile.

member.name: F:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.MsStorageMode.ProfileSpectrum
member.summary: Spectra are stored as "raw" data, typicaly with multiple points spanning each ion peak in the spectrum.

member.name: F:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.MsStorageMode.PeakDetectedSpectrum
member.summary: Results of peak detection on the spectrum are stored. Each ion peak is represented by its centroid mass or m/z and its abundance.

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.MidacSpecFormat
member.summary: How to interpret the x,y data in a MidacSpecData object

member.name: F:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.MidacSpecFormat.Unspecified
member.summary: No enum value is specified

member.name: F:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.MidacSpecFormat.Metadata
member.summary: Only include metadata without any (x,y) data

member.name: F:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.MidacSpecFormat.Peak
member.summary: Each peak in the spectrum is represented by one (x,y) point

member.name: F:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.MidacSpecFormat.Profile
member.summary: A full spectrum with typically multiple points spanning each peak. Includes all points, even those with Y .LE. 0.
member.remarks: Y values may be 10 5 1 0 0 0 0 0 1 5 10 5 1 0 0 0

member.name: F:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.MidacSpecFormat.ZeroTrimmed
member.summary: A profile spectrum with all points having Y .LE. 0 removed.
member.remarks: Y values may be 10 5 1 . . . . . 1 5 10 5 1 . . . where "." marks a missing point

member.name: F:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.MidacSpecFormat.ZeroBounded
member.summary: A profile spectrum with all points having Y .LE. 0 removed EXCEPT FOR the points surrounding each region in which Y .GT. 0.
member.remarks: Y values may be 10 5 1 0 . . . 0 1 5 10 5 1 0 . . where "." marks a missing point

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.ITofMassCalibrations
member.summary: Provides access to the TOF mass calibration data from a data file, properly overriding the default calibration with IRM or User calibration if those exist.

member.summary: Get the average TOF calibration over all scans in the file that use the specified ion polarity.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.ITofMassCalibrations.ScanTofCal(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the TOF calibration to be used with the specified scan number (or, for IMS, with all scans from the same frame as the specfied scan). This will be the user calibration (if any) else the IRM calibration (if any) else the default calibration.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.ITofMassCalibrations.CalibratedPolarities
member.summary: Return the IonPolarity for which TOF calibration has been done (or Mixed if there is calibration for both polarities).

member.summary: Get access to the reader

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.ITofMassCalInfo
member.summary: Provides access to TOF mass calibration information for all of the scans in a single data file that are based on the same default calibration.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.ITofMassCalInfo.TofCal(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the calibration appropriate for use with a specified (1-based) scan number. Priority is UserCal > IrmCal > DefaultCal

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.ITofMassCalInfo.TofCal(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the average of the calibrations applicable to scans within a specified scan number range (0:0 returns the average of all scans). For each included scan, the priority is UserCal > IrmCal > DefaultCal.
member.param: Zero or minimum scan number
Zero or maximum scan number

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.ITofMassCalInfo.TofCal(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
member.summary: Get the average of the calibrations applicable to an itemized list of scans (identified by their 1-based scan numbers). For each included scan, the priority is UserCal > IrmCal > DefaultCal.

member.summary: Removes all IRM calibration from this instance

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.ITofMassCalInfo.ClearUserCalibration
member.summary: Removes all User calibration from this instance

member.summary: The ion polarity of scans associated with this calibration set

Zero or maximum scan number

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.ITofMassCalReader
member.summary: Provides tools to read/write TOF mass calibration information. Any read/write operations ensure that they have appropriate locks on the data file (via AcqData/contents.xml) is locked before they proceed.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.ITofMassCalReader.ReadDefaultCalibration
member.summary: Reads (or re-reads) default calibration from the AcqData/DefaultMassCal.xml file and clears any override (IRM or User) calibration information.
member.remarks: ITofMassCalInfo instances retrieved after this have only default calibration and no information on IonPolarity

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.ITofMassCalReader.ReadCalibrationOverrides(Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IMsScanInfoAccess)
member.summary: Reads any per-scan (or per-frame) calibration data, whether IRM or User cal, that exists. Also verifies (for IMS files) that the file contains only a single ion polarity. Files read: MSMassCal.bin, MSUserCal.bin, and MSUserCalIndex.bin.
member.param: An accessor for MS Scan Info collection, to be used if needed to access IRM calibration information.
member.returns: A reference to the library holding all the information that was read.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.ITofMassCalReader.ContainsCalId(System.Int16)
member.summary: Get a flag indicating if there is information for a specified default mass calibration ID.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.ITofMassCalReader.GetMassCalInfo(System.Int16)
member.summary: Get the calibration information associated with a specified default calibration ID.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.ITofMassCalReader.GetMassCalInfo(Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IonPolarity)
member.summary: Get the first calibration found that matches the specified IonPolarity

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.ITofMassCalReader.OverrideCalibrationsExist
member.summary: Return a flag indicating whether scan-specific calibration overrides (IRM or User) exist in this file.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.ITofMassCalReader.CalIds
member.summary: Get a list of all the default calibration ID values found in the file

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.ITofMassCalReader.CalibrationPolarities
member.summary: Get an indication of the ion polarity (or polarities) for which calibration data exist.
member.remarks: IMS only supports single-polarity data files, but Archer files might return a value of Mixed.

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IImsFrameBinIo
member.summary: The base interface for classes that can read and write data from ImsFrame.bin files. For reading and writing complete files, use the ReadBinFile() and WriteBinFile() functions with the FileData property. For incremental file creation an writing, use ReadAndValidateSchema(), CopySchema(), CreateBinFile() and AppendBinFileRecord().

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IImsFrameBinIo.Clear
member.summary: Clear the contents of this instance.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IImsFrameBinIo.ReadFile(System.Int32)
member.summary: Read the contents of the AcqData/ImsFrame.bin file of the MassHunter data file (.d) with which this instance is associated. Also reads the AcqData/ImsFrame.xsd schema file if that has not already been done.
member.param: The maximum number of frame records to be read (used with unfinished data files to read only those known to be completely written). Use -1 to signify "all".
member.returns: The data collection from the file.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IImsFrameBinIo.WriteFile
member.summary: Write all current data to the AcqData/ImsFrame.bin file of the MassHunter data file (.d) with which this instance is associated. Overwrites any curent file without warning.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IImsFrameBinIo.ReadAndValidateSchema(System.String)
member.summary: Reads a specified ImsFrame schema file and ensures that schema is valid. May only be called when this instance is empty and not already in use for incremental writing.
member.param: Full path of the schema file to be validated. Need not (yet) be in the AcqData folder of the data file or named "ImsFrame.xsd".
member.remarks: ReadFile() or WriteFile() will read the schema if necessary; you need not call this first.
member.returns: A representation of the schema in the file, if valid. Null otherwise.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IImsFrameBinIo.CopySchema(System.String)
member.summary: A utility to copy a schema file from a specified path (and file name) to the AcqData folder of the current data file, renaming it if necessary to ImsFrame.xsd. Overwrites the destination file without warning. Does not open or validate the schema file.
member.param: Full path of the schema file to be copied.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IImsFrameBinIo.CreateBinFile(Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IImsFrameBinHeader)
member.summary: Creates an ImsFrame.bin file in the current data file's AcqData folder and holds that file open for later calls to write file records.
member.param: File header information
member.remarks: Error if an ImsFrame.bin file is already open. Overwrites any existing file without warning.

member.summary: Closes any ImsFrame.bin that was open for incremental writing.

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IMsScanBinIo
member.summary: The base interface for classes that can read and write data from MSScan.bin files. For reading and writing complete files, use the ReadFile() and WriteFile() functions with the FileData property. For incremental file creation an writing, use ReadAndValidateSchema(), CopySchema(), CreateBinFile() and AppendBinFileRecord().

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IMsScanBinIo.Clear
member.summary: Clear the contents of this instance.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IMsScanBinIo.ReadFile(System.Int32)
member.summary: Read the contents of the AcqData/MSScan.bin file of the MassHunter data file (.d) with which this instance is associated. Also reads the AcqData/MSScan.xsd schema file if that has not already been done.
member.param: The maximum number of scan records to be read (used with unfinished data files to read only those known to be completely written). Use -1 to signify "all".
member.returns: The data read from the file, with one entry for each scan that was read.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IMsScanBinIo.WriteFile
member.summary: Write all current data to the AcqData/MSScan.bin file of the MassHunter data file (.d) with which this instance is associated. Overwrites any curent file without warning.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IMsScanBinIo.ReadAndValidateSchema(System.String)
member.summary: Reads a specified MSScan schema file and ensures that schema is valid. Must be called when this instance is empty and not already in use for incremental writing.
member.param: Full path of the schema file to be validated. Need not (yet) be in the AcqData folder of the data file or named "MSScan.xsd".
member.remarks: It is not necessary to call the prior to calling either ReadFile() or WriteFile(), which will read the schema if necessary.
member.returns: A representation of the schema in the file, if valid. Null otherwise.

member.summary: A utility to copy a schema file from a specified path (and file name) to the AcqData folder of the current data file, renaming it if necessary to MSScan.xsd. Overwrites the destination file without warning. Does not open or validate the schema file.
member.param: Full path of the schema file to be copied.

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IMsScanBinRecord
member.summary: Defines the set of values that may be associated with one record read from (or written to) an MScan.bin file. Supports values that may be found in IMS files and/or MassHunter files acquired on non-IMS instruments.
member.remarks: Remarks indicate the type of data file (IMS or other) in which this data is expected in MSScan.bin. Note that for many of the "IMS only" values, the data IS in an IMS file, but in either ImsFrameMeth.xml or ImsFrame.bin.

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IMS.FrameData
member.summary: An object that holds all of the data for a single IMS frame that is to be written to the data file. This includes per-frame information (for ImsFrame.bin), the set of spectra belonging to the frame (for MSProfile.bin) and the scan headers for those spectra (for MSScan.bin).
