member.summary: Does final preparation that must wait until all spectra have been added but be done before the data can be written to disc. Sorts frame scans in drift order, assigns Scan ID values, gathers overall frame metrics, etc.

The default mass calibration (matching the ion polarity of this frame's data) used for this data file

The starting scan ID to be applied to the spectra in this frame. Incremented as necessary and, on return, suitable for use with some other spectrum or frame.
The default mass calibration (matching the ion polarity of this frame's data) used for this data file

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IMS.FrameData.AddTfsProfileSpectrum(System.Double,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Add a "total mobility" mass spectrum as a full (non-encoded) abundance array.
member.param: The flight time of the first point in abundArray. Flight time point spacing is obtaine from the FrameMethod.
A gapless array of ion abundance values
member.remarks: Explicitly adding a TFS spectrum here will disable automatic calculation of the TFS if frame spectra are added later. But if frame spectra are to be added FIRST, it will avoid wasted computation if FrameData constructor's autoAccumulateTfs flag is false.

The metrics obtained when encoding the array
The encoded abundance array
member.remarks: Explicitly adding a TFS spectrum here will disable automatic calculation of the TFS if frame spectra are added later. But if frame spectra are to be added FIRST, it will avoid wasted computation if FrameData constructor's autoAccumulateTfs flag is false.

a copy of ImsFrameScanRec

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IMS.ImsFrameSchemaReader.FieldNumber(Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.ImsFrameField)
member.summary: Get the number of a field. Field numbers are assigned in the order in which fields are found in the schema, and represent the order in which data is expected to be written in ImsFrame.bin header records. (With the exception of the special "group start" fields that are only markers in the schema and do not have values in the header recoreds.)

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IMS.ImsFrameSchemaReader.FieldValueType(Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.ImsFrameField)
member.summary: Get the data type used to store a specified field in the scan header records of ImsFrame.bin. Note that this is the type specified in the schema file and (for version 1 files) is largely ignored -- types to be read are assumed and hard-coded. In version 2 files, these types are strictly honored.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IMS.ImsFrameSchemaReader.HasValues(Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.ImsFrameField)
member.summary: Get the flat indicating whether the a file actually has values for a specified field that was defined in the schema.

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IEicRtMzRanges
member.summary: RT and m/z parameters for a set of EICs to be extracted at the same time. The EICs share a common RT range, but may differ in their m/z values. Each EIC may be independently based on one or more m/z values.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IEicRtMzRanges.Clear
member.summary: Reset to as-initialized state

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IEicRtMzRanges.ID
member.summary: Set or get an ID value that can be used to find this entry after a list of them has been sorted or otherwised reordered.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IEicRtMzRanges.RtMin
member.summary: The minimum of the RT range over which the EIC is to be extracted

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IEicRtMzRanges.RtMax
member.summary: The maximum of the RT range over which the EIC is to be extracted

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IEicRtMzRanges.MzList
member.summary: The list of m/z values to be extracted for the EIC. Each is expanded according to parameters in IBDAMultiEicParameters.
member.remarks: Either MzList or MzRangeList should be specified, but not both.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IEicRtMzRanges.MzRangeList
member.summary: A list of m/z ranges to be extracted for the EIC. These are not expanded farther, but are used "as is".
member.remarks: Either MzList or MzRangeList should be specified, but not both.

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDAMultiEicParameters
member.summary: A collection of parameters used to extract multiple EICs in one pass through the data file. The EICs have all the same parameters (filters) except for their m/z range(s).

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDAMultiEicParameters.ChromFilter
member.summary: Set or get the BDAChromFilter that specifies the data to be extracted for all chromatograms except for the list(s) of m/z values.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDAMultiEicParameters.EicRtMzList
member.summary: Set or get the list of EIC parameters, with one value for each EIC to be extracted. Each entry on this list carries the RT range and list of m/z values for one EIC.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDAMultiEicParameters.MzExpansionMode
member.summary: Set or get the m/z expansion mode to be applied to each value on the MzListList

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDAMultiEicParameters.SingleMzExpansionWidth
member.summary: If the expansion mode is SymmetricMz, the m/z range is the specified value +/- this delta (in amu)

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDAMultiEicParameters.SinglePpmExpansionWidth
member.summary: If the expansion mode is SymmetricPpm, the m/z range is the specified value +/- this delta (in ppm)

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDAMultiEicParameters.AsymmetricMzWidthLow
member.summary: If the expansion mode is AsymmetricMz, the m/z range starts at the m/z value minus this delta (in amu)

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDAMultiEicParameters.AsymmetricMzWidthHigh
member.summary: If the expansion mode is AsymmetricMz, the m/z range ends at the m/z value plus this delta (in amu)

member.summary: set or get the TOF saturation threshold, expressed as a percentage of the maximum possible abundance in each spectrum.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDAPeakSpecFilter.UseTofSaturationMzRange
member.summary: set or get the flag that indicates if TOF saturation is to be detected only within specified m/z range(s).

member.summary: Spectrum filter used during extraction This maps to PSetExtractSpectrum

member.returns: An interface on the new object

member.summary: Typesafe override for Object.Equals. Compares values of all fields

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDASpecFilter.SpectrumType
member.summary: Set or get the Spectrum type
member.remarks: The only values that make sense for extraction of spectra from a data file are UVSpectrum, MassSpectrum and TofMassSpectrum

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDASpecFilter.SpectrumSubType
member.summary: Set or get the Spectrum sub type
member.value: a Spectrum sub type enumerated value
member.remarks: The only values that make sense for extraction of spectra from a data file are unspecified, HighE and LowE. This is for AllIons.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDASpecFilter.ScanRange
member.summary: Set or get the ScanRange(s) - retention time ranges over which spectra are summed or averaged. If the ScanIds array has values, those will override the ScanRange when extracting spectra (see also IBDASpecFilter.AverageSpecta).

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDASpecFilter.MassRange
member.summary: Mass range to include in the spectrum to be returned. Masses outside of this range are omitted from the spectrum when it is retrieved from the file.
member.remarks: The end points should probably be inclusive. For mass spectrum a min max range is normally used. For UV spectrum a center/width range is usual.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDASpecFilter.MSLevelFilter
member.summary: Set or get the MSLevel filter( All, MS, MS/MS )

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDASpecFilter.MSScanTypeFilter
member.summary: Set or get the MSScanTypeFilter filter

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDASpecFilter.MzOfInterestFilter
member.summary: Set or get the MzOfInterestFilter for ScanMode=MS/MS

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDASpecFilter.IonPolarityFilter
member.summary: Set or get the IonPolarity filter

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDASpecFilter.FragmentorVoltage
member.summary: Set or get the range of fragmentor voltages for which spectra are extracted. A range of 0:0 means no filtering on fragmentor.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDASpecFilter.CollisionEnergy
member.summary: Set or get the range of collision energies for which spectra are extracted. A range of 0:0 means no filtering on collision energy.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDASpecFilter.IonizationMode
member.summary: Set or get the Ionization Mode filter

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDASpecFilter.DesiredMSStorageType
member.summary: Set or get the storage type whose spectra are extracted.
member.remarks: PeakElseProfile, ProfileElsePeak and All are valid when asking for a spectrum to be extracted. Each extracted spectrum will always have one of the values Peak or Profile

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDASpecFilter.MassUnits
member.summary: Set or get the flag that indicates whether TOF mass spectra should be reported in mass units rather than flight time units.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDASpecFilter.ExtractByCycle
member.summary:
Set or get the flag that indicates whether spectrum should be extracted by cycle or not. I.e., whether spectra corresponding to different cycles (scan methods) should be reported individually instead of being summed together.
This value is set based on its parent Chromatogram. If the parent chromatogram is a Cycle Summed one, then the spectrum being extracted for it would be set to true, else if the chromatogram was a normal one then this flag would set to false

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDASpecFilter.ScanIds
member.summary: Set or get an array of ScanID values that specify which spectra are averaged or summed (see also IBDASpecFilter.AverageSpectrum).
member.remarks: This is for the foreground spectrum if the reported spectrum is background subtracted, as during APSE

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDASpecFilter.AverageSpectrum
member.summary: Set or get the flag that indicates whether multiple spectra should be averaged together. If false, then the spectra are summed.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDASpecFilter.DeviceName
member.summary: Set or get the Device Name parameter

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDASpecFilter.OrdinalNumber
member.summary: Set or get the Ordinal Number parameter

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDASpecFilter.ChromPeakIndex
member.summary: Set or get the zero-based index of the chromatogram peak used for Automatic Peak Spectrum Extraction.
member.remarks: A negative value implies that APSE is not being used. Note that the copy of BDASpecFilter attached to a BDASpecData has it's ChromPeakIndex value set when the spectrum is extracted, but the spectrum's ChromPeakIndex property may later be changed.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDASpecFilter.BackgroundScanRanges
member.summary: set or get the array of scan (RT) ranges for the background spectrum that is accumulated or averaged and then subtracted from the foreground spectrum.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDASpecFilter.XClipRanges
member.summary: Set or get the range(s) of points to be retained in the spectrum. Points outside of these ranges are removed. A null or empty array means no clipping is done.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDASpecFilter.ZeroBoundWhenClipping
member.summary: Set or get a flag that indicates whether x-ranges retained during clipping should be bounded by a zero-abundance point

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDASpecFilter.ScaleFactorY
member.summary: Set or get a scale factor to be applied to the y-values of the spectrum. A value of zero means no scaling is done.
member.remarks: Used to scale raw spectra to match a paired MFE spectrum.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDASpecFilter.ScaledAbundanceLimit
member.summary: Set or get an AbundanceLimit value that overrides the one read from the data file for the final spectrum's description.
member.remarks: Used in setting saturation threshold for raw spectra to match the equivalent of a paired MFE spectrum.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDASpecFilter.CompensationField
member.summary: Set or get the range of FAIMS compensation field values for which spectra are extracted. An EMPTY range means no filtering, because zero is a legitimate compensation field value.

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDASpecFilter.DispersionField
member.summary: Set or get the range of FAIMS dispersion field values for which spectra are extracted. An EMPTY range means no filtering, because zero is a legitimate compensation field value.

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.MSScanInfoMgr
member.summary: This class used to hold the implementation. Now we need two different implementations, one for traditional files and one for IMS files. An instance of this class is instantiated by DataFileMgr very early, and that instance is passed around to many other classes (all before a file is opened and we know what type it is). So the easist retrofit seems to be to move the "real" implementation into an inner class, which can be one of two types depending on the type of file we eventually discover that we have.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.MSScanInfoMgr.GetClosestRetentionTimes(System.Double[],Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.DataUnit)
member.summary: Finds the closest scan numbers for the retention times (In array conversion) Handles a single as well as multiple points. Takes care of 1. Rounding of values 2. Clipping the values to the rang DOES NOT ASSUME Monotonically increasing order!, however that case will never come
member.param: array of values, expected as scan numbers as input Returned back as retention times, specified by dataUnit
specifies the dataUnit of output array. The method does gives back values in expected dataUnit, i.e. second or minute. If second unit, does conversion on the fly from default minutes values

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.MSScanInfoMgr.GetClosestScanNumbers(System.Double[],Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.DataUnit)
member.summary: Finds the closest scan numbers for the given retention times. (in array conversion) Handles a single as well as multiple points. 1. If the retention time is within the range, finds the CLOSEST retention time and for that, the corresponding scan number 2. If the retention time is out of range, it will clip to to start or end retention time and get the corresponding scan number ASSUMES:: Retention times are monotonically increasing Handles retention times, having duplicates as well as where 4, 4.1, 4.2 scan all should map to say 115 scanID
member.param: array of values, expected as minutes or seconds specified by dataUnit. returned back as scannumbers
dataUnit of the current array. If current dataunit is seconds, it converts to default minutes and uses it

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.MSFilterObject
member.summary: Keeps information about a filter object for scan records

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.MSFilterObject.InitFilteringOneTime(Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.MSLevel,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.MSScanType,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IonPolarity,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IonizationMode)
member.summary: Given what is in the data file, determine whether or not any filtering needs to be done on a scan record. The input parameters specify what MS level, scan type, polarity and ion mode are in the data file. The member variables of this class (m_MSLvelFilter, m_ScanTypeFilter, etc) must have been set already to indicate what the filter is looking for. If the filter is looking for MS level of MSMS, and the OverallMSLevel is MSMS (meaning all the scan records in this data file are all MSMS), then we don't need to filter a scan record on MS level, because all scan records in the data file match the criteria. We check for these properties including mz of interest, fragmentor voltage, and collision energy, and return false if no filter needs to be done based on these properties.

member.summary: Returns a new object that represents the difference between the operands (op1 - op2).

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.BdaSpecMath.ZeroEmpty(Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IBDASpecData,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Remove zero abundance points from the spectrum, but optionally keeping the zero abundance points that bound regions of contiguous zero-valued ones.
Modified version from DataObjectsUtility.cs to handle cases where fileSamplingType is Unspecified Get the XSamplingType to be set in the data object based on the type of spectrum we're dealing with
member.returns: an XSamplingType value
member.remarks: [Sep 8, 2009] A latest plan: Spectrum obj XSamplingType draw mode Addition XUncertainty --------- ----------------- --------- ----------- ------------ Q Peak Irregular line AddIrregular 0.20001 Q SIM/MRM Discontinuous line AddIrregular 0 Q Profile Step,Bounded connect interpolate 0 TOF Peak Irregular line AddIrregular 200 ppm TOF Prof mz Continuous,Bounded connect interpolate compute TOF Prof ns Step,bounded connect interpolate 0 ICPMS Prof SparseStepped,Bounded line Q Profile(MzXML) Continuous connect interpolate 0

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.BdaSpecMath.DecideAdditionAlgorithm(Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.XSamplingType,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.XSamplingType,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: A method to map the XSampling types to the appropriate addition algorithm. This function also returns the step sizes for Stepped or SparseSstepped data (in other cases step is returned as zero) For sparse stepped the step size is returned as smallest natural spacing in the array.
member.param: XSamplingType for first operand
XSamplingType for second operand
True if xArray1 contins the initial X value and X spacing, False if the array contains explicit x values
True if xArray2 contins the initial X value and X spacing, False if the array contains explicit x values
X values for the first operand
X values for the second operand
(output) Zero if the first operand is not [sparse] stepped, else the step size for that operand
(output) Zero if the second operand is not [sparse] stepped, else the step size for that operand
(output) whether the data is some kind of stepped or not

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.RangeTranslator
member.summary: Responsible for translating overlapping and merging ranges. Also exclude ranges specified Does not perform:: If there are single points, they are not excluded!

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.RangeTranslator.TranslateRanges(Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.BDARangeCollection,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.BDARangeCollection,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.IRange)
member.summary: Translates inclusive and exclusive ranges to a final range. Takes care of ignoring ranges if they are empty or null. For include range to be ignored and if exclude range present, it needs an overall range for includeranges!
member.param: Input include range collection
input exclude range collection
Needed only when include range is ignore, but exclude range is present
member.remarks: The BDARangeCollection returned has properties like: The range is ordered on x, non-overlapping, hence ordered on y also If exclude ranges are present, the range collection is minus the exclude ranges. It has NO empty ranges inside it

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.RangeTranslator.TranslateRanges(Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.BDARangeCollection)
member.summary: Translates a single range collection. Sorts and merges the range collection and assigns it to the m_MergedRanges
member.param: Input range collection
member.remarks: The BDARangeCollection returned has properties like: The range is ordered on x, non-overlapping, hence ordered on y also It has NO empty ranges inside it

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.RangeTranslator.SortMergeRanges(Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.BDARangeCollection)
member.summary: Sort and then merge overlapping ranges TODO:: Although the code handles removing duplicates, it needs to be verified

members.member:
Merge the combined Include range with the exclude ranges, returns new collection
BDARangeCollection, first subtrahend, A BDARangeCollection, second subtrahend, B Returns new BDARangeCollection, A-B :::::Assumes that excludeRange is never empty!

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.DataAnalysis.RangeTranslator.MergedIncludeRanges
